chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco A. Cruz Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1 and Ct 2 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and follow all recommendations, releasing all records to the agent upon request.

The defendant shall have no contact with his victim or the family of the victim of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way without prior approval from the agent.  Defendant shall not be on or around the premises of where the victim and the victim's family reside.  
Defendant shall have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 except incidental contact.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted 24 days credit for time served.  Jail sentence is on Ct 1 only

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco A. Cruz Castro
